data.title: Update glShaderContext_src.cxx
data.body: Replace warning() by info(), since its not an important warning and may spam the console.

data.title: Add a --wheel flag for generating `.whl` distributions.
data.body:
Here's the first revision of the wheel generator, ready for criticism. I've only tested on Linux, but I don't see any reason it shouldn't work on all platforms as-is.

For Windows and Mac, we can upload these archives to PyPI, but for Linux, we'll need to host a URL for them to live at, since PyPI doesn't allow binary distributions for Linux.

data.title: Work around timestamp precision in ramdisks
data.body:
When writing multiple times per second to a file on a VirtualFileMountRamdisk, the file is not cached properly. This is due to the timestamp resolution (which only captures seconds).

This PR fixes the issue, by ensuring that the modified timestamp is always greater than the original timestamp.
This might lead to timestamps from the future, however this is not a concern.

The proper solution would be to switch to a higher precision timer, but for now, this fixes the issue.

data.title: Support for imageCubeArray, remove _EXT suffix
data.body:
This PR adds support for the imageCubeArray GLSL type (GL_IMAGE_CUBE_MAP_ARRAY).
Also, the _EXT suffix is removed from the GL_IMAGE types.

data.title: Add new terrain implementation (ShaderTerrainMesh)
data.body: This PR adds a new ShaderTerrainMesh class which is capable of rendering huge terrains on the GPU, using shaders. Further information can be found here: ShaderTerrainMesh Additionally a new sample (`samples/shader-terrain`) was added to show the basic usage of the terrain. The terrain has several advantages over the existing terrain implementations in Panda3D (HeightfieldTesselator, GeoMipTerrain), mainly being much faster and capable of handling huge heightfields.

data.title: Add bilinear filtering to TexturePeeker
data.body: This adds the `calc_bilinear_point` method to the TexturePeeker, so bilinear lookups can be performed. This is similar to `PfmFile::calc_bilinear_point()`.

data.title: Add more formats to TexturePeeker, emit error if format is not supported
data.body: This PR adds more formats to the TexturePeeker, and more important, emits an error in case the format is currently not supported so the user knows whats going wrong (Except getting errors because `Texture::peek()` returns `None`)

data.title: New file headers, new comment style
data.body: **This is the fixed version of the previous pull request here** This pull request converts the entire source to the javadoc comment style. This includes new-style license headers. A new documentation comment looks like: ``` c++ /** * This is a brief description. This is the long description, it contains * information about the method. */ void actual_method() { // ... } ``` The `Access:` and `Function:` parameters got removed, since they provided redundant information. The new license header looks like: ``` c++ /** * PANDA 3D SOFTWARE * Copyright (c) Carnegie Mellon University. All rights reserved. * * All use of this software is subject to the terms of the revised BSD * license. You should have received a copy of this license along * with this source code in a file named "LICENSE." * * @file dtool.cxx * @author drose * @date 2000-05-15 */ ``` Additionally all trailing whitespace is removed, and all files were modified to contain exactly one newline at their end. For reference, here are the scripts used to translate the comments (a lot of manual work was required to fix up invalid comment syntax): Script 1: Script to update the license headers (by rdb) Script 2: Script to update the comments Script2 depends on Script1 to be run before.

data.title: New comments
Fix typo in glGraphicsStateGuardian
data.body: This pr fixes a typo in glGraphicsStateGuardian, preventing text and sprites to be rendered with their color only.

data.title: Fix swizzle masks on vector types
data.body:
This pull requests fixes certain swizzle masks on the builtin vector types, namely those derived from LVecBase3 and LVecBase4. 

It ensures that calling get_xy() on a LPoint3f for example returns an LPoint2f, and not LVecBase3f.

data.body: I didn't even test it.

data.title: workaround for NVidia 361.43 driver bug
data.body:
This driver returns internal/synthetic uniform shaders when
asked for the list of active uniforms. They all start with
"_main_" and have names like "_main_0_gp5fp[0]". We need to
ignore these, otherwise, Panda will later crash with failed
assertions when trying to set this unknown uniform.

data.title: Assimp: Support skeletons with unconnected bones
data.body: We needed to detect islands of bones and create anims and parts for them.

data.title: Assimp: Add initial support for skeletal mesh animations
data.body:
[skel_anim.zip](https://github.com/panda3d/panda3d/files/76065/skel_anim.zip) contains:
- animbox.blend - Original blend file
- animbox.dae - COLLADA file exported from Blender via Godot's Better COLLADA addon
- main.py - Script used to test the changes

Known issues:
- A model will fail to load if all channels in an animation do not have the same number of keyframes
- Any animations on the skeleton/armature itself are not converted since it is not a bone (and thus not in the bonemap)
- Animations from COLLADA files exported by Godot's Better COLLADA addon do not have a name
  - Not sure if this is an issue with the addon or with Assimp
  - For the time being, all AnimBundleNodes are given the name "anim" since the animations mName is empty

data.title: openal: Grab volume from manager instead of assuming max volume.
data.body:
Apologies for the whitespace cleanup (editor does so automatically).

This fixes the assumption that the manager has a volume level of 1.0 when the sound is constructed, and instead uses the volume within the manager.

data.title: Update README
data.body: In order to build an installer on Mac you will need PackageMaker, which is a pain in the rear to find. Saying where to download it in the README will save the stress of looking for it.
